key_points: ABC's 'The Rookie' bans the use of 'live' weapons on set following the fatal shooting on the 'Rust' set.
Showrunner Alexi Hawley issued a letter to the cast and crew announcing the change.
The decision was influenced by the incident on the 'Rust' set where Halyna Hutchins was killed.
Airsoft guns will now be used on 'The Rookie', with effects added in post-production.
Weapons expert Ben Simmons categorizes prop guns into fake, deactivated, and real firearms.
Hawley emphasized the importance of cast and crew safety in his decision.
CNN seeks comments from ABC and 'The Rookie' representatives.
The investigation into the 'Rust' shooting incident is still ongoing.
Alec Baldwin was told the prop gun was a 'cold gun' before the fatal shooting.
Assistant director David Halls unknowingly handed Baldwin a gun with live rounds.
